channel.title: CVE Feed for Hitachi Energy -- RTU500 series CMU firmware
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Hitachi Energy -- RTU500 series CMU firmware

item.title: CVE-2022-2081|2024-09-24T14:31:33.084Z -- hitachi%20energy -- rtu500%20series%20cmu%20firmware
item.description: A vulnerability exists in the HCI Modbus TCP function included in the product versions listed above. If the HCI Modbus TCP is enabled and configured, an attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted message to the RTU500 in a high rate, causing the targeted RTU500 CMU to reboot. The vulnerability is caused by a lack of flood control which eventually if exploited causes an internal stack overflow in the HCI Modbus TCP function.

item.title: CVE-2024-2617|2024-08-01T19:18:48.011Z -- hitachi%20energy -- rtu500%20series%20cmu%20firmware
item.description: A vulnerability exists in the RTU500 that allows for authenticated and authorized users to bypass secure update. If a malicious actor successfully exploits this vulnerability, they could use it to update the RTU500 with unsigned firmware.

item.title: CVE-2024-2617|2024-06-04T17:29:04.729Z -- hitachi%20energy -- rtu500%20series%20cmu%20firmware
item.description: A vulnerability exists in the RTU500 that allows for authenticated and authorized users to bypass secure update. If a malicious actor successfully exploits this vulnerability, they could use it to update the RTU500 with unsigned firmware.
